text: The greatest job I ever had was working on my family farm. Each morning my father would come into my bedroom around 4:30 am and command me to get up and work the fields. I would spend the next two hours before school slopping pigs and cropping tobacco.
author: Armstrong Williams

author: Laura Hillenbrand

text: Every time I get up in the morning, melodies occur to me and I start trying to shape lyrics to melodies.

text: Never get married in the morning - you never know who you might meet that night.
